TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: What's your favourite mod mods?

> 
> What's your favourite mod mods?

Not really a question about the forums, and if you look back in the thread this one has been asked already and answered by a few mods.
When a person becomes a mod, is their a breaking in or training period?
Real question have you ever get rid of a bad moderator?

> 
> When a person becomes a mod, is their a breaking in or training period?

There's a few stickies to read in the moderator's part of the forum, plus we get coached in IRC. From what I've seen new moderators ask about every little thing at first while getting the hang of things (I certainly did).

> 
> When a person becomes a mod, is their a breaking in or training period?

Yes, sort of a training period, every senior mod is helpful and keen about what the new moderators may have trouble with, full of good advice and happy to let them test and improve their skills. You all confirm junior mods, right?

> 
> There's a few stickies to read in the moderator's part of the forum, plus we get coached in IRC. From what I've seen new moderators ask about every little thing at first while getting the hang of things (I certainly did).

IRC? Is that just the system you use?

> 
> IRC? Is that just the system you use?

Internet Relay Chat, it's basically multiplayer notepad. There's an official channel for KSP in the links at the top of the page.
Oh! Ok, thanks
When a user has a white rep bar, how much reputation power does he/she have?

> 
> When a user has a white rep bar, how much reputation power does he/she have?

Same as they have if they left rep display enabled. The forum software is still keeping track of accumulated rep.
Why infractions expire?

> 
> Why infractions expire?

They expire so that people can hopefully learn, move on, and be good community members.
And what happens when they still active? o\_O

> 
> And what happens when they still active? o\_O

Well, there is a system. If one accumulates too many infraction points over too few days then there are appropriate punies pour them, starting with post restrictions and ending with an interdit.

> 
> And what happens when they still active? o\_O

The moderation points accumulate if the poster receives more infractions. If a user reaches 25 points, they are added to the moderation queue until enough points expire to fall below 25 again.

Edit: Duoja'd.

> 
> [A]ppropriate punies pour them

I want to be poured by an appropriate puny. It sounds like a dearie toon.
In the space Lounge->Forum Games, I am a Game Moderator for "The Number War!." How do you guys feel about threads, such as forum games, that require users to act as Mods for that thread?

> 
> In the space Lounge->Forum Games, I am a Game Moderator for "The Number War!." How do you guys feel about threads, such as forum games, that require users to act as Mods for that thread?

I think we'd rather you called yourself a referee or judge, using the term moderator may lead others to approach you with forum moderation stuff, which would not be appropriate.
Ok, thanks! I'll change my title.

> 
> The moderation points accumulate if the poster receives more infractions. If a user reaches 25 points, they are added to the moderation queue until enough points expire to fall below 25 again.
> Edit: Duoja'd.

So, pretty much, reaching 25 points simply puts you on the radar, so to speak?

> 
> So, pretty much, reaching 25 points simply puts you on the radar, so to speak?

Sort of. Any points get you on the radar since we don't hand out that many infractions, getting queued usually means earlier moderation attempts weren't effective.
